Words to Kick Your Teeth Out

Wotan

Of those all ⁠— that Wotan call, number in good homeless men to Valhalla they go ⁠— was one⁠—eye I know ⁠— a hobo they ken

For too many of hobos have talking heads And starved nine days without bread

Have you slept in the rain? 'Neath a tree? I'll show you the runes ⁠— the triangle hands

And all hobo's of old ⁠— the railroad rode You think Sleipnir was fast as the line?

And a Norse god of old ⁠— should know how to drink So who would you have? ⁠— The drunk or the erg'?

For a thief and a king ⁠— a warrior's dirge!

Paging

Gacc/Gock

The Wrath That Might Have Been
